revised_title: Salt Relations in Woody Tissues: Experiments with Lengths of Wood and Cut Leafy Shoots
tldr: This study investigates the salt relations in woody tissues by examining the flow of solutions through lengths of yew wood and transpiring leafy shoots. The authors found that the bulk of the supply to the bark is by way of the wood, and the rate of exchange between water-free space and Donnan-free space in the wood is rapid compared to that between water-free space and living cells. The results provide insights into the transport of ions and solutes in plants.
